Class OmegaLibrary

  • java.lang.Object
    • OmegaLibrary

  • public class OmegaLibrary
extends java.lang.Object
    This singleton stores the backbone-dependent omega data. Omega is defined as the the dihedral angle of the amide bond. Random numbers are drawn from a normal distribution centered on the given mean and standard deviation in the database. A new NormalDistribution and associated apache RandomGenerator are generated for each draw. To be more multithreading efficient, we could delegate the random number generator to the calling class, but we're leaving it this way for now. The library tells you how the omega(+1) dihedral depends on the current torsion, psi(0), and the following torsion, phi(+1). Here is the diagram from the library:

    omega(0) phi(0) psi(0) omega(+1) phi(+1) psi(+1) omega(+2)

    - N( 0) - Ca( 0) - C( 0) - N(+1) - Ca(+1) - C(+1) -

    current residue following residue

    The library contains some global data starting with "All" but that data are ignored because we assume we're given the amino acids on either side of the torsion. There's a confusing convention that omega precedes an amino acid in the N to C direction, but we follow it anyways.

    • Method Detail

      • getNormalDistribution

        private static org.apache.commons.math3.distribution.NormalDistribution getNormalDistribution(Residue residue1,
                                                                             Residue residue2)
        Returns a normal distribution for the omega torsion of residue2, based on the identities of residue1 and residue2 and the enclosing phi angles, psi0 and phi1.
        Parameters:
        residue1 - the preceding residue (N to C direction)
        residue2 - the following residue (N to C direction)
        Returns:
        the normal distribution for the residue2 omega torsion

      • getOmega

        public static double getOmega(Residue residue1,
              Residue residue2)
        Returns a random omega given psi0 of the preceding residue1 and the phi1 of the following residue2. Nulls are not allowed.
        Parameters:
        residue1 - the preceding residue (N to C direction)
        residue2 - the following residue (N to C direction)
        Returns:
        a random, normally-distributed value for the omega of residue2 based on the database values

      • determineKey

        private static java.lang.String determineKey(Residue residue1,
                            Residue residue2)
        Returns the database key for this combination of residues. Residue 1 precedes residue 2 in the N to C direction.
        Parameters:
        residue1 - the residue before the omega1 torsion
        residue2 - the residue after the omega1 torsion
        Returns:
        the database key

      • snapToGrid

        private static  snapToGrid( inputPair)
        rounds phi and psi to nearest multiple of 10
        Parameters:
        inputPair - e.g. phi1,psi0 (-179.0, -178.0)
        Returns:
        the nearest pair on the grid e.g., phi, psi (-180.0, 180.0)
